intro: Mesembryanthemum dyeri, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It typically blooms in spring and summer, producing bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. Mesembryanthemum dyeri is a popular ornamental plant due to its resilience and aesthetic appeal.
